tag_list: boston-bookworks, coopratings, zazu, ecommerce, ratings, mobile-applications, huskyinnovationchallenge
overview:
Punit Shah is an avid Entrepreneur based out of Boston, Ma.

Punit has been involved in the Entrepreneurship and Finance space for the last 4 years, starting companies such as Boston BookWorks - an international drop shipping textbook business, Coopratings.com - a ratings community site where students were enabled to share ratings of their co-op/internship experiences and most recently Zazu, a mobile device application that helps users wake up with the information they need to get their day started on the right foot.

Previous experience in Finance includes working for venture debt firm Hercules Technology Growth Capital and as a Venture Capital Consultant for a major international consulate.

Punit will be a 2010 Graduate of Northeastern University. While at Northeastern, Punit played an integral role in the restructure of the entrepreneurship community as President of the Entrepreneurs Club, spearheading new initiatives like the Husky Innovation Challenge and the Entrepreneurship Immersion Program which promoted growth of innovation and collaboration.
